content: knit a mitered square dishcloth in the least-intuitive way this simple project uses kitchen cotton and basic wrap & turn short row to make a square it s a good way to make a dishcloth and this free pdf pattern makes 3 sizes **materials ** * 1 ball or 55 70 80 yds worsted-weight kitchen cotton * 1 16 circular needle or one pair of straight needles in us7/4 5mm or size needed for gauge * tapestry needle for weaving in ends **gauge ** gauge is 14 sts and 32 row over 4 /10cm of lightly blocked garter stitch worked flat please be sure to check your gauge **measurements ** as shown this square dishcloth measures about 8 9 10 /20 23 25 cm on each side **from now through june 25th buy any two regularly-priced patterns from my ravelry portfolio 1 and get a third of equal or lesser value free to redeem this offer check out with three patterns in your cart there s no coupon code required ** 1 https //www ravelry com/designers/nick-davis
